text: The French Women's Volleyball League is the major volleyball national competition for women in France, established since 1941League history in sports123.com Retrieved 3 May 2020. It is organised by the Ligue Nationale de Volley (LNV) an independent Volleyball Body that organize all Volleyball competitions in France. ==History== In the 2018/19 season in Ligue AF 14 teams had participated in the regular season and 8 of them had qualified to the play-offs: ASPTT Mulhouse, Racing Club de Cannes, Volero Le Cannet, Volley- Ball Nantes, Béziers Volley, Pays d'Aix Venelles VB, AS Saint-Raphaël VB, VC Marcq-en-Barœul. The championship title was won by the "Racing Club de Cannes", who won the final series by beating "Volley-Ball Nantes" 2–0 (3:1, 3:1). ==Winners List== {| class="wikitable" style="display:inline-table;" !
